Package dao.services.interfaces

Interface AccountRepository<T extends Account>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccountService<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccountServiceImpl, CheckingAccountServiceImpl, SavingAccountServiceImpl
    public interface AccountRepository<T extends Account>
    The interface provides a contract between classes on how want interact with the table "account". Interfaces for receiving general accounts. Generic must be extended Account.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ruslan Pipan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Account findAccountByBankAccount​(long bankAcc)
      Is looking for an account in the database by his bank account.
      Account findAccountById​(int id)
      Is looking for an account in the database by his primary id.
      java.util.List<T> findAccountsByConsumer​(int consumerId)
      Is looking for an accounts in the database by his consumer id.
      java.util.List<T> findAccountsByConsumer​(Consumer consumer)
      Is looking for an accounts in the database by his Consumer object.

    • Method Detail

      • findAccountByBankAccount

        Account findAccountByBankAccount​(long bankAcc)
        Is looking for an account in the database by his bank account.
        Parameters:
        bankAcc - by bank account there will be a search in the database.
        Returns:
        Account if bank account present in the database, else empty account.

      • findAccountById

        Account findAccountById​(int id)
        Is looking for an account in the database by his primary id.
        Parameters:
        id - by id there will be a search in the database.
        Returns:
        Account if bank account present in the database, else empty account.

      • findAccountsByConsumer

        java.util.List<T> findAccountsByConsumer​(int consumerId)
        Is looking for an accounts in the database by his consumer id.
        Parameters:
        consumerId - by id consumer there will be a search in the database.
        Returns:
        List if bank accounts present in the database, else empty List.

      • findAccountsByConsumer

        java.util.List<T> findAccountsByConsumer​(Consumer consumer)
        Is looking for an accounts in the database by his Consumer object.
        Parameters:
        consumer - by consumer there will be a search in the database.
        Returns:
        List if bank accounts present in the database, else empty List.
